abstract: Most stocks fell Monday for the first time in four days after confidence in the home building industry dropped to a 16-year low.
snippet: Most stocks fell Monday for the first time in four days after confidence in the home building industry dropped to a 16-year low.
lead_paragraph: Most stocks fell yesterday for the first time in four days after confidence in the home building industry dropped to a 16-year low, renewing concern that the housing slump was not over.

headline.main: Ending a Climb, Shares Slip Amid Concern on Housing
headline.print_headline: Ending a Climb, Shares Slip Amid Concern on Housing

abstract: Both Gannett and Dow Jones & Company are trying to capture more of the high-end consumer advertising market.
snippet: Both Gannett and Dow Jones & Company are trying to capture more of the high-end consumer advertising market.
lead_paragraph: The Gannett Company plans to introduce a glossy magazine insert for USA Today later this year, and Dow Jones & Company is contemplating a similar move for The Wall Street Journal, as both companies seek to capture more of the high-end consumer advertising market.

headline.main: Glossy Insert at Gannett, and Maybe Dow Jones
headline.print_headline: Glossy Insert at Gannett, and Maybe Dow Jones

abstract: Though Pearson is exploring the possibility of bidding alongside General Electric for Dow Jones, Pearson’s third-largest shareholder, Schroders, an investment company, urged the company not to get into a bidding war with Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation, The Telegraph reported Tuesday.
lead_paragraph: Though Pearson is exploring the possibility of bidding alongside General Electric for Dow Jones, Pearson’s third-largest shareholder, Schroders, an investment company, urged the company not to get into a bidding war with Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation, The Telegraph reported Tuesday.

headline.main: Pearson Shareholder Criticizes Potential Dow Jones Bid
